snippets.title: Filter Object
snippets.description: Filter out entries in an object where the value is falsy, including empty strings, empty objects, null, and undefined.
code: .filter(([key, value]) => value !== null && value !== undefined && value !== '' && (typeof value !== 'object' || Object.keys(value).length > 0))
const obj1 = { a: 1, b: null, c: undefined, d: 4, e: '', f: {} };
const obj2 = { x: 0, y: false, z: 'Hello', w: [] };
const obj3 = { name: 'John', age: null, address: { city: 'New York' }, phone: '' };
console.log(filterObject(obj3)); // Output: { name: 'John', address: { city: 'New York' } }
const obj4 = { a: 0, b: '', c: false, d: {}, e: 'Valid' };
snippets.author: realvishalrana

snippets.author: realvishalrana

snippets.title: Unique By Key
snippets.description: Filters an array of objects to only include unique objects by a specified key.
code: arr.filter((obj, index, self) => index === self.findIndex((t) => t?.[key] === obj?.[key]));
console.log(uniqueByKey('id', arr)); // Output: [{ id: 1, name: 'John' }, { id: 2, name: 'Jane' }]
snippets.author: realvishalrana

snippets.title: Merge Objects Deeply

snippets.title: Get Days in Month

code: const getDaysInMonth = (year, month) => new Date(year, month + 1, 0).getDate();
console.log(getDaysInMonth(2024, 1)); // Output: 29 (February in a leap year)

snippets.title: Convert to Unix Timestamp
snippets.description: Converts a date to a Unix timestamp in seconds.
code: * Converts a date string or Date object to Unix timestamp in seconds.
* @param {string|Date} input - A valid date string or Date object.
* @throws {Error} - Throws an error if the input is invalid.
throw new Error('Date string cannot be empty or whitespace');
throw new Error('Input must be a valid date string or Date object');
console.log(convertToUnixSeconds(new Date())); //Current Unix timestamp in seconds (varies depending on execution time)
